content: 1 Paul､ an apostle of Christ Jesus— By injunction of God our Saviour and Christ Jesus our hope,—
content_old: 1 Paul､ an apostle of Christ Jesus— By injunction of God our Saviour and Christ Jesus our hope,—

content: 2 Unto Timothy､ my true child in faith: Favour､ mercy､ peace, From God our Father､ and Christ Jesus our Lord.
content_old: 2 Unto Timothy､ my true child in faith: Favour､ mercy､ peace, From God our Father､ and Christ Jesus our Lord.

content: 3 Even as I exhorted thee to remain in Ephesus､ when I was journeying into Macedonia, That thou mightest charge some—
content_old: 3 Even as I exhorted thee to remain in Ephesus､ when I was journeying into Macedonia, That thou mightest charge some—

content: 4 Not to be teaching otherwise､ Nor yet to be giving heed to stories and endless genealogies,— The which bring arguings､ rather than that stewardship of God which is with faith;—
content_old: 4 Not to be teaching otherwise､ Nor yet to be giving heed to stories and endless genealogies,— The which bring arguings､ rather than that stewardship of God which is with faith;—

content: 5 Now the end of the charge is love— Out of a pure heart､ And a good conscience､ And faith unfeigned,—
content_old: 5 Now the end of the charge is love— Out of a pure heart､ And a good conscience､ And faith unfeigned,—

content: 6 Which some､ missing have turned them aside unto idle talk,
content_old: 6 Which some､ missing have turned them aside unto idle talk,

content: 7 Desiring to be law-teachers,—Not understanding､ either what they say or whereof they confidently affirm.
content_old: 7 Desiring to be law-teachers,—Not understanding､ either what they say or whereof they confidently affirm.

content: 8 Now we know that excellent is the law､ if one put it to a lawful use:—
content_old: 8 Now we know that excellent is the law､ if one put it to a lawful use:—

content: 9 Knowing this— That to a righteous man law doth not apply, But to the lawless and insubordinate､ ungodly and sinful､ irreligious and profane､ smiters of fathers and smiters of mothers､ murderers､
content_old: 9 Knowing this— That to a righteous man law doth not apply, But to the lawless and insubordinate､ ungodly and sinful､ irreligious and profane､ smiters of fathers and smiters of mothers､ murderers､

content: 10 fornicators､ sodomites､ man-stealers､ liars､ falses-wearers,— And if anything else unto the healthful teaching is opposed;—
content_old: 10 fornicators､ sodomites､ man-stealers､ liars､ falses-wearers,— And if anything else unto the healthful teaching is opposed;—

content: 11 According to the glad-message of the glory of the happy God, with which entrusted am I.
content_old: 11 According to the glad-message of the glory of the happy God, with which entrusted am I.

content: 12 Grateful am I unto him that empowered me､ Christ Jesus our Lord, In that faithful he accounted me､ Putting me into ministry,—
content_old: 12 Grateful am I unto him that empowered me､ Christ Jesus our Lord, In that faithful he accounted me､ Putting me into ministry,—

content: 13 Though formerly a defamer､ and persecutor､ and insulter; Nevertheless mercy was shown me､ because without knowledge I acted､ in unbelief:
content_old: 13 Though formerly a defamer､ and persecutor､ and insulter; Nevertheless mercy was shown me､ because without knowledge I acted､ in unbelief:

content: 14 Yet exceeding abundant was the favour of our Lord､ with faith and love which are in Christ Jesus.
content_old: 14 Yet exceeding abundant was the favour of our Lord､ with faith and love which are in Christ Jesus.

content: 15 Faithful the saying! and of all acceptance worthy,— That Christ Jesus came into the world sinners to save: Of whom the chief am I;—
content_old: 15 Faithful the saying! and of all acceptance worthy,— That Christ Jesus came into the world sinners to save: Of whom the chief am I;—

content: 16 Nevertheless on this account was mercy shewn me,�� That in me､ the chief Christ Jesus might shew forth his entire long-suffering, For an ensample of them about to believe on him unto life age-abiding.
content_old: 16 Nevertheless on this account was mercy shewn me,�� That in me､ the chief Christ Jesus might shew forth his entire long-suffering, For an ensample of them about to believe on him unto life age-abiding.

content: 17 Now unto the King of the ages,— Incorruptible､ invisible､ alone God Be honour and glory､ unto the ages of ages. Amen!
content_old: 17 Now unto the King of the ages,— Incorruptible､ invisible､ alone God Be honour and glory､ unto the ages of ages. Amen!

content: 18 This charge I commit unto thee､ child Timothy､ According to the prophecies running before on thee, In order that thou mightest war､ with them､ the noble warfare,
content_old: 18 This charge I commit unto thee､ child Timothy､ According to the prophecies running before on thee, In order that thou mightest war､ with them､ the noble warfare,

content: 19 Holding faith and a good conscience,— Which some thrusting from them Concerning their faith have made shipwreck:—
content_old: 19 Holding faith and a good conscience,— Which some thrusting from them Concerning their faith have made shipwreck:—

content: 1 I exhort､ therefore､ first of all, that there be made— Supplications､ prayers､ intercessions､ thanksgivings, In behalf of all men,—
content_old: 1 I exhort､ therefore､ first of all, that there be made— Supplications､ prayers､ intercessions､ thanksgivings, In behalf of all men,—

content: 2 In behalf of kings､ and all them who are in eminent station; In order that an undisturbed and quiet life we may lead､ In all godliness and gravity:
content_old: 2 In behalf of kings､ and all them who are in eminent station; In order that an undisturbed and quiet life we may lead､ In all godliness and gravity:

content: 3 This is comely and acceptable before our Saviour God,
content_old: 3 This is comely and acceptable before our Saviour God,

content: 4 Who willeth all men to be saved､ And unto a personal knowledge of truth to come;
content_old: 4 Who willeth all men to be saved､ And unto a personal knowledge of truth to come;

content: 5 For there is one God､ One mediator also､ between God and men,— A man—Christ Jesus:
content_old: 5 For there is one God､ One mediator also､ between God and men,— A man—Christ Jesus:

content: 6 Who gave himself a ransom in behalf of all,— The testimony in its own fit times:
content_old: 6 Who gave himself a ransom in behalf of all,— The testimony in its own fit times:

content: 7 Unto which I have been appointed proclaimer and apostle—Truth I speak､ I utter no falsehood—A teacher of nations､ in faith and truth.
content_old: 7 Unto which I have been appointed proclaimer and apostle—Truth I speak､ I utter no falsehood—A teacher of nations､ in faith and truth.

content: 8 I am minded､ therefore, that— The men in every place be offering prayer, Uplifting hands of Iovingkindness､ Apart from anger and disputings;
content_old: 8 I am minded､ therefore, that— The men in every place be offering prayer, Uplifting hands of Iovingkindness､ Apart from anger and disputings;

content: 9 In the same way that the women— In seemly attire､ with modesty and sober-mindedness be adorning themselves,— Not with plaitings and ornamentation of gold､ or with pearls､ or with costly apparel,—
content_old: 9 In the same way that the women— In seemly attire､ with modesty and sober-mindedness be adorning themselves,— Not with plaitings and ornamentation of gold､ or with pearls､ or with costly apparel,—

content: 10 But Which becometh women promising godliness Through means of good works.
content_old: 10 But Which becometh women promising godliness Through means of good works.

content: 11 Let a woman in quietness be learning in all submission;
content_old: 11 Let a woman in quietness be learning in all submission;

content: 12 But teaching—unto a woman I do not permit, Nor yet to have authority over a man,— But to be in quietness;
content_old: 12 But teaching—unto a woman I do not permit, Nor yet to have authority over a man,— But to be in quietness;

content: 13 For Adam first was formed､ Then Eve,
content_old: 13 For Adam first was formed､ Then Eve,

content: 14 And Adam was not deceived, Whereas the woman having been wholly deceived hath come to be in transgression;
content_old: 14 And Adam was not deceived, Whereas the woman having been wholly deceived hath come to be in transgression;

content: 1 If anyone for oversight is eager A noble work doth he covet:—
content_old: 1 If anyone for oversight is eager A noble work doth he covet:—

content: 2 It is needful､ then､ for the overseer to be irreproachable､ a husband of one wife､ sober､ of sound mind､ orderly､ hospitable､ apt in teaching,
content_old: 2 It is needful､ then､ for the overseer to be irreproachable､ a husband of one wife､ sober､ of sound mind､ orderly､ hospitable､ apt in teaching,

content: 3 Not given to wine､ not ready to wound, But considerate､ averse to contention､ not fond of money,
content_old: 3 Not given to wine､ not ready to wound, But considerate､ averse to contention､ not fond of money,

content: 4 Over his own house presiding well, Having children in submission､ with all dignity;
content_old: 4 Over his own house presiding well, Having children in submission､ with all dignity;

content: 5 Whereas if anyone over his own house cannot preside How of an assembly of God shall he take care?
content_old: 5 Whereas if anyone over his own house cannot preside How of an assembly of God shall he take care?

content: 6 Not a new convert, Lest being be-clouded into the sentence of the adversary he fall;
content_old: 6 Not a new convert, Lest being be-clouded into the sentence of the adversary he fall;

content: 7 It is needful､ moreover､ to have an honourable testimony also from them who are without, Lest into reproach he fall､ and the snare of the adversary.
content_old: 7 It is needful､ moreover､ to have an honourable testimony also from them who are without, Lest into reproach he fall､ and the snare of the adversary.

content: 8 Ministers in the same way—Dignified, not double-tongued､ not to much wine given､ not greedy of base gain,
content_old: 8 Ministers in the same way—Dignified, not double-tongued､ not to much wine given､ not greedy of base gain,

content: 9 Holding the sacred secret of the faith in a pure conscience;
content_old: 9 Holding the sacred secret of the faith in a pure conscience;

content: 10 But let these also be proved first, Then let them be ministering､ being unaccusable:
content_old: 10 But let these also be proved first, Then let them be ministering､ being unaccusable:

content: 11 Wives in the same way—Dignified, not given to intrigue, sober､ faithful in all things.
content_old: 11 Wives in the same way—Dignified, not given to intrigue, sober､ faithful in all things.

content: 12 Let ministers be husbands of one wife, Over children presiding well､ and over their own houses;
content_old: 12 Let ministers be husbands of one wife, Over children presiding well､ and over their own houses;

content: 13 For they who have ministered well a good degree for themselves are acquiring, and great freedom of speech in the faith that is in Christ Jesus.
content_old: 13 For they who have ministered well a good degree for themselves are acquiring, and great freedom of speech in the faith that is in Christ Jesus.

content: 14 These things unto thee I am writing､ Hoping to come unto thee shortly,—
content_old: 14 These things unto thee I am writing､ Hoping to come unto thee shortly,—

content: 15 But if I should tarry That thou mayest know— How it behoveth in a house of God to behave oneself,— The which is an assembly of a Living God, A pillar and basement of the truth;—
content_old: 15 But if I should tarry That thou mayest know— How it behoveth in a house of God to behave oneself,— The which is an assembly of a Living God, A pillar and basement of the truth;—

content: 1 Howbeit the Spirit expressly saith— That in later seasons some will revolt from the faith, Giving heed unto seducing spirits､ And unto teachings of demons—
content_old: 1 Howbeit the Spirit expressly saith— That in later seasons some will revolt from the faith, Giving heed unto seducing spirits､ And unto teachings of demons—

content: 2 in hypocrisy speaking falsehood, Of demons cauterised in their own conscience,—
content_old: 2 in hypocrisy speaking falsehood, Of demons cauterised in their own conscience,—

content: 3 Forbidding to marry､ Commanding to abstain from foods which God created to be received with thanksgiving by them who believe and personally know the truth;
content_old: 3 Forbidding to marry､ Commanding to abstain from foods which God created to be received with thanksgiving by them who believe and personally know the truth;

content: 4 Because every creature of God is good, And nothing to be cast away､ If with thanksgiving it be received,—
content_old: 4 Because every creature of God is good, And nothing to be cast away､ If with thanksgiving it be received,—

content: 5 For it is hallowed by the word of God and intercession.
content_old: 5 For it is hallowed by the word of God and intercession.

content: 6 These things submitting to the brethren Thou shalt be a noble minister of Christ Jesus, Nourishing thyself with the words of the faith､ and of the noble teaching which thou hast closely studied.
content_old: 6 These things submitting to the brethren Thou shalt be a noble minister of Christ Jesus, Nourishing thyself with the words of the faith､ and of the noble teaching which thou hast closely studied.

content: 7 But from the profane and old-wives” stories excuse thyself, And be training thyself unto godliness;
content_old: 7 But from the profane and old-wives” stories excuse thyself, And be training thyself unto godliness;

content: 8 For the bodily training for little is profitable, Whereas godliness for all things is profitable､— Having promise of life—The present and the coming.
content_old: 8 For the bodily training for little is profitable, Whereas godliness for all things is profitable､— Having promise of life—The present and the coming.

content: 9 Faithful the saying! and of all accepttance worthy;
content_old: 9 Faithful the saying! and of all accepttance worthy;

content: 10 For to this end are we toiling and contending, Because we have set our hope on a Living God､ Who is Saviour of all men—SpeciaIly of such as believe.
content_old: 10 For to this end are we toiling and contending, Because we have set our hope on a Living God､ Who is Saviour of all men—SpeciaIly of such as believe.

content: 11 Be giving these things in charge､ and be teaching:—
content_old: 11 Be giving these things in charge､ and be teaching:—

content: 12 Let no one despise thy youth, But an ensample become thou､ of the faithful,— In discourse､ in behaviour､ in love､ in faith､ in chastity.
content_old: 12 Let no one despise thy youth, But an ensample become thou､ of the faithful,— In discourse､ in behaviour､ in love､ in faith､ in chastity.

content: 13 While I am coming be giving heed— To the reading､ to the exhorting､ to the teaching:
content_old: 13 While I am coming be giving heed— To the reading､ to the exhorting､ to the teaching:

content: 14 Be not careless of the gift of favour that is in thee, Which was given thee through means of prophesying､ along with a laying on of the hands of the eldership.
content_old: 14 Be not careless of the gift of favour that is in thee, Which was given thee through means of prophesying､ along with a laying on of the hands of the eldership.

content: 15 These things be thy care, In these things be thou,— That thine advancement may be manifest unto all:
content_old: 15 These things be thy care, In these things be thou,— That thine advancement may be manifest unto all:

content: 1 An elderly man do not thou reprimand, But beseech him､ as though he were thy father,— Younger men､ as brothers,
content_old: 1 An elderly man do not thou reprimand, But beseech him､ as though he were thy father,— Younger men､ as brothers,

content: 2 Elderly women､ as mothers, Younger women､ as sisters, in all chastity.
content_old: 2 Elderly women､ as mothers, Younger women､ as sisters, in all chastity.

content: 3 Widows honour thou—who indeed are widows:—
content_old: 3 Widows honour thou—who indeed are widows:—

content: 4 Howbeit if any widow hath children or grandchildren Let them be learning—first unto their own house to be shewing reverence､ And returns to be making unto their progenitors; For this is acceptable before God;
content_old: 4 Howbeit if any widow hath children or grandchildren Let them be learning—first unto their own house to be shewing reverence､ And returns to be making unto their progenitors; For this is acceptable before God;

content: 5 But she who is indeed a widow､ and is left alone Hath turned her hope towards God, And is giving attendance unto the supplications and the prayers､ night and day,—
content_old: 5 But she who is indeed a widow､ and is left alone Hath turned her hope towards God, And is giving attendance unto the supplications and the prayers､ night and day,—

content: 6 Whereas she that runneth riot while living is dead:
content_old: 6 Whereas she that runneth riot while living is dead:

content: 7 And these things be giving in charge､ That without reproach they may be;
content_old: 7 And these things be giving in charge､ That without reproach they may be;

content: 8 If､ however､ anyone for his own､ and specially them of his household taketh not forethought His faith hath he denied､ And is worse than one without faith!
content_old: 8 If､ however､ anyone for his own､ and specially them of his household taketh not forethought His faith hath he denied､ And is worse than one without faith!

content: 9 Let a widow be put on the list— Having become not less than sixty years old,— One man’s wife,
content_old: 9 Let a widow be put on the list— Having become not less than sixty years old,— One man’s wife,

content: 10 In noble works being well-attested;— If she hath nourished children, If she hath shewn hospitality, If saints’ feet she hath washed, If them who were in tribulation she hath succoured, If in every good work she hath followed on:
content_old: 10 In noble works being well-attested;— If she hath nourished children, If she hath shewn hospitality, If saints’ feet she hath washed, If them who were in tribulation she hath succoured, If in every good work she hath followed on:

content: 11 But younger widows decline thou; For as soon as they wax wanton against the Christ To marry are they determined,—
content_old: 11 But younger widows decline thou; For as soon as they wax wanton against the Christ To marry are they determined,—

content: 12 Having､ as sentence､— That their first faith they have set at nought;
content_old: 12 Having､ as sentence､— That their first faith they have set at nought;

content: 13 At the same time to be idlers are they learning, Going about from house to house; And not only idlers but gossips also, and busybodies,— Saying the things they ought not.
content_old: 13 At the same time to be idlers are they learning, Going about from house to house; And not only idlers but gossips also, and busybodies,— Saying the things they ought not.

content: 14 I am minded､ therefore､ that the younger ones marry､ bear children､ be mistress of the house,— Giving no single occasion unto the opposer､ as a cause of reviling;
content_old: 14 I am minded､ therefore､ that the younger ones marry､ bear children､ be mistress of the house,— Giving no single occasion unto the opposer､ as a cause of reviling;

content: 15 For already some have turned aside after Satan:
content_old: 15 For already some have turned aside after Satan:

content: 16 If any believing woman hath widows Let her be giving them succour､ And not suffer the assembly to be burdened,— That them who are indeed widows it may itself succour.
content_old: 16 If any believing woman hath widows Let her be giving them succour､ And not suffer the assembly to be burdened,— That them who are indeed widows it may itself succour.

content: 17 Let the well presiding elders of double honour be accounted worthy, Especially they who toil in discourse and teaching;
content_old: 17 Let the well presiding elders of double honour be accounted worthy, Especially they who toil in discourse and teaching;

content: 18 For the scripture saith— A threshing ox shalt thou not muzzle, And— Worthy is the workman､ of his hire.
content_old: 18 For the scripture saith— A threshing ox shalt thou not muzzle, And— Worthy is the workman､ of his hire.

content: 19 Against an elder entertain not an accusation､ except at the mouth of two or three witnesses;
content_old: 19 Against an elder entertain not an accusation､ except at the mouth of two or three witnesses;

content: 20 But them who are sinning before all do thou reprove, That the rest also may have fear:—
content_old: 20 But them who are sinning before all do thou reprove, That the rest also may have fear:—

content: 21 I adjure thee before God､ and Christ Jesus､ and the chosen messengers That these things thou observe､ apart from prejudgment, doing nothing by partiality.
content_old: 21 I adjure thee before God､ and Christ Jesus､ and the chosen messengers That these things thou observe､ apart from prejudgment, doing nothing by partiality.

content: 22 Hands､ suddenly upon no one lay, Neither have fellowship with sins of strangers: Thyself keep chaste:—
content_old: 22 Hands､ suddenly upon no one lay, Neither have fellowship with sins of strangers: Thyself keep chaste:—

content: 23 No longer be a water-drinker, But of a little wine make use､ Because of thy stomach and thy frequent sicknesses.
content_old: 23 No longer be a water-drinker, But of a little wine make use､ Because of thy stomach and thy frequent sicknesses.

content: 24 Some men’s sins are openly evident､ leading on into judgment, With some however､ they even follow after;
content_old: 24 Some men’s sins are openly evident､ leading on into judgment, With some however､ they even follow after;

content: 1 Let as many as are servants under a yoke be counting their own masters worthy of all honour, Lest the name of God and the teaching be defamed.
content_old: 1 Let as many as are servants under a yoke be counting their own masters worthy of all honour, Lest the name of God and the teaching be defamed.

content: 2 They､ however, that have believing masters let them not despise them､ because they are brethren, But the more be doing them service､ because believing and beloved are they who from the good workmanship receive advantage. These things be teaching､ and exhorting:—
content_old: 2 They､ however, that have believing masters let them not despise them､ because they are brethren, But the more be doing them service､ because believing and beloved are they who from the good workmanship receive advantage. These things be teaching､ and exhorting:—

content: 3 If anyone doth otherwise teach､ And doth not adhere to healthful discourses—those of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the teaching that is according to godliness
content_old: 3 If anyone doth otherwise teach､ And doth not adhere to healthful discourses—those of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the teaching that is according to godliness

content: 4 He is beclouded, knowing nothing rightly, But is diseased about questionings and word-battles— Out of which spring envy､ strife､ defamations､ wicked surmisings､
content_old: 4 He is beclouded, knowing nothing rightly, But is diseased about questionings and word-battles— Out of which spring envy､ strife､ defamations､ wicked surmisings､

content: 5 incessant quarrellings of men wholly corrupt in their mind and bereft of the truth,—Supposing godliness to be a means of gain!
content_old: 5 incessant quarrellings of men wholly corrupt in their mind and bereft of the truth,—Supposing godliness to be a means of gain!

content: 6 Now it is a great means of gain—godliness､ with a sufficiency of one’s own;
content_old: 6 Now it is a great means of gain—godliness､ with a sufficiency of one’s own;

content: 7 For nothing brought we into the world, Neither to take anything out are we able;—
content_old: 7 For nothing brought we into the world, Neither to take anything out are we able;—

content: 8 And having sustenance and covering we shall be content;
content_old: 8 And having sustenance and covering we shall be content;

content: 9 But they who are determined to be rich fall into temptation､ and a snare, and many foolish and hurtful covetings, The which sink men into ruin and destruction,—
content_old: 9 But they who are determined to be rich fall into temptation､ and a snare, and many foolish and hurtful covetings, The which sink men into ruin and destruction,—

content: 10 For a root of all the vices is the love of money, Which some､ being eager for have been seduced from the faith､ and have pierced themselves about with many pangs.
content_old: 10 For a root of all the vices is the love of money, Which some､ being eager for have been seduced from the faith､ and have pierced themselves about with many pangs.

content: 11 But thou O man of God! From these things flee! And pursue righteousness､ godliness､ faith､ love､ endurance､ meekness;
content_old: 11 But thou O man of God! From these things flee! And pursue righteousness､ godliness､ faith､ love､ endurance､ meekness;

content: 12 Be contesting the noble contest of the faith,— Lay hold of the age-abiding life— Unto which thou wast called､ And didst make the noble confession before many witnesses.
content_old: 12 Be contesting the noble contest of the faith,— Lay hold of the age-abiding life— Unto which thou wast called､ And didst make the noble confession before many witnesses.

content: 13 I charge thee before God､ who engendereth life in all things, And Christ Jesus､ who before Pontius Pilate witnessed the noble confession
content_old: 13 I charge thee before God､ who engendereth life in all things, And Christ Jesus､ who before Pontius Pilate witnessed the noble confession

content: 14 That thou keep the commandment without spot､ free from reproach, Until the forthshining of our Lord Jesus Christ—
content_old: 14 That thou keep the commandment without spot､ free from reproach, Until the forthshining of our Lord Jesus Christ—

content: 15 Which in its own fit times the happy and only Potentate will shew— The King of them that reign､ And Lord of them that wield lordship,—
content_old: 15 Which in its own fit times the happy and only Potentate will shew— The King of them that reign､ And Lord of them that wield lordship,—

content: 16 Who alone hath immortality, Dwelling in light unapproachable,— Whom no man hath seen—nor can see: Unto whom be honour and might age-abiding. Amen.
content_old: 16 Who alone hath immortality, Dwelling in light unapproachable,— Whom no man hath seen—nor can see: Unto whom be honour and might age-abiding. Amen.

content: 17 Upon them who are rich in the present age lay thou charge— Not to be high-minded､ Nor to have set their hope on riches’ uncertainty,— But on God､ who offereth us all things richly for enjoying,
content_old: 17 Upon them who are rich in the present age lay thou charge— Not to be high-minded､ Nor to have set their hope on riches’ uncertainty,— But on God､ who offereth us all things richly for enjoying,

content: 18 To be doing good､ To be rich in noble works, To be generous in giving､ Ready for fellowship,—
content_old: 18 To be doing good､ To be rich in noble works, To be generous in giving､ Ready for fellowship,—

content: 19 Treasuring up for themselves a good foundation for the future, That they may lay hold on the life which is life indeed.
content_old: 19 Treasuring up for themselves a good foundation for the future, That they may lay hold on the life which is life indeed.

content: 20 O Timothy! that which hath been entrusted do thou guard, Avoiding the profane pratings and oppositions of falsely named knowledge,—
content_old: 20 O Timothy! that which hath been entrusted do thou guard, Avoiding the profane pratings and oppositions of falsely named knowledge,—
